result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R Chavarria was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven R Chavarria is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven R Chavarria was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.
  • Steven R Chavarria was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Any and all conditions DOC may impose.  Random testing by blood, breath or urine.  DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work/child care/educational courses.  If the Sheriff's Department believes GPS or home monitor is appropriate court will approve.  If defendant obtains his GED before 270 days have past the court will hold in advance the 270 days, so the defendant can earn his way out of jail early (90 days) Defendant must have a certificate in hand to the sheriff's department, district attorney and the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Undergo an assessment. Complete all treatment. Obtain a GED or HSED. No contact w/ Lawrence or Jolene Bildeau.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven R Chavarria in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Steven R Chavarria in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and appearances.   State speaks re: sentencing.  Atty Chapman speaks to the court.  Defendant speaks to the court.  
Sentencing-


Count 1--6 years total sentence.
3  years of confinement 3 years on E.S


Count 3-6 years total sentence.
3  years of confinement 3 years on E.S

Conditions: undergo an assessment. Complete all treatment. GED/HSED requirements
No contact w/ Lawrence or Jolene Bildeau. 

Concurrent w/ Sentence serving now.
681 Days credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 6, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Steven R Chavarria in court, in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Court speaks to Mr. Chavarria. Mr. Chavarria makes statement re tying to get a public defender. Court has a conversation with the Defendant. Court orders Mr. Chavarria to call the public defender's office to see what they can do. DE will stay in Washburn County Jail until Friday, try to an Attorney appointment and hearing by Friday; otherwise DE will have to be transported back to Prison.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 31, 2017 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 30, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Steven R Chavarria in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Steven R Chavarria in custody.   Attorney Thomas Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2:53 PM Court calls case and recites appearances.  State argues sentencing disagrees with recommendations of probation - requests 12 months of jail time.  Atty Gramstrup makes arguement jt. recommendation jail to be concurrent with Burnett County case.  Defendant addressed the Court. 

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 3 years - costs to all counts - 92 days time served 360 days jail huber for work/child care/educational courses - if sheriff thinks GPS or home monitor is appropriate that is approved - random testing of blood, breath or urine - if obtain GED before 270 days have past the court will hold in advance the 270 days can earn way out of jail early (must have the GED in hand) - DNA sample  and surcharge - any conditions DOC may impose - 
 
Count 3 - Sentence w/held probation 3 years - concurrent
Sentencing hearing on November 6, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Steven R Chavarria in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Steven R Chavarria in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances.   Court questions the def. regarding his plea questionaire and waiver of rights.   Atty Gramstrup speaks to the court. 
Court continues questioning. Court finds that def understands his constitutional rights and freely and knowingly waives them and that there is a factual basis in count 1 and count 3.  

Count 1-Def. plead no contest. Court accepts plea and finds def. guilty.  JOC is ordered. 

Count 2-Dismissed

Count 3- Def. plead no contest. Court accepts plea and finds def. guilty. JOC is ordered. 

Court orders a PSI to be prepared. Agent need not appear.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Plea hearing on September 18, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Steven R Chavarria in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Steven R Chavarria in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:56 am Court recites case & appearances; DA/Atty G - entering a plea to Ct. 1 & 3; Court ?'s deft re: rights, etc.; DA tenders Information to court; cont'd ?'g of deft; deft waives
prelim - court finds deft has so waived; Court recites Cts on Information & waives reading; Atty G - pleads to Ct. 1 & 3 - no contest, Ct 2 dismissed, 13 CF 63 also encompassed (Judge K's file)
so will x out that case no.; Court - plea set for 1:15 pm.  Adj'd 12:01 p.m.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 18, 2014 at 11:55 am.

Defendant Steven R Chavarria in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Steven R Chavarria in custody.  Thomas H. Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances.  Waived Reading. Not Guilty Plea is entered. Waived time limits.  Bail will continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 11:55 am.
$2500 SB; not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed doctor; provide address w/i 24 hours of being discharged, return date: 8/25/2014 at 10 a.m.
